did you all know that a barrel of crude oil had dropped $10.00 a barrel as of 12/8? I haven't seen any diff in gas prices, has anyone? Makes me soooooooo angry!!! emoticon_mad

Delivery dates are in the future. The gasoline you're consuming was bought at higher crude prices. And a couple of weeks of lower crude cost isn't going to be reflected in refined prices unless it continues down on a steady basis.

Hehe
 but when crude oil prices go UP, the price at the pump goes up that day (in anticipation).
 
 But I've seen gas prices go down 0.10-0.20 per gallon the past week or so.
 
 Where is was 1.95 it's now about 1.70-1.80.

Hehe

I filled up for $1.48.9 last week...in Mississippi; $1.52.9 yesterday in Atlanta.
 
 What we need is a gas war!
 
 The reason the prices go up as soon as the crude does is that the vendor has to make enough money to refill his bulk storage. It does seem like they could reverse the process when the prices are falling, but they hardly ever do.
 
 ...and do you remember the gasoline "shortage" of the '80s? (There wasn't really a shortage. I know a farmer who had well over 250,000 gallons on hand.)

What we need is a gas war!
 

 
 Or a gas strike. I was unlucky enough to be caught in london during the Britsh gas strike and it was amazing. People simply shut off their cars, trucks, etc... and walked away. Left them sitting in the street. It shut down the entire country. True they wussed out before tehy actually got what they wanted, but they definatly got some concessions.
 
 A lot of the higher gas prices in the face of lwoer oil prices is also profit taking by the station owners. I know the local caseys is getting their gas for $1.38 right now and selling for $1.69. Every time the station up the road drops a couple of cents, so does caseys. They are not trying to give the consumer the best deal, just to provide a slightly better deal than the guy up the road.

Reckon it's a right wing conspiracy?

Reckon it's a right wing conspiracy?

 
 Probably not. As a charter member of the vast right wing conspiracy, I think I would have been notified. 
 
 I would say just a bunch of greedy station owners,

What astute business owner would pass any opportunity to increase profit margins on a commodity based product? As with any serious addiction, the consumer pays the price or goes without. I'm sure that statement will bring cries of necessity, god given rights and demands for big brother government to take care of citizens. 
 
 The retail gasoline industry has been investigated for price fixing more times than congress has for ethics violations. With a clean record.

Or a gas strike. I was unlucky enough to be caught in london during the Britsh gas strike and it was amazing. People simply shut off their cars, trucks, etc... and walked away. Left them sitting in the street. It shut down the entire country. True they wussed out before tehy actually got what they wanted, but they definatly got some concessions.
 

 
 Yes, that was quite a time. I remember the contingency plans that we ready at the hospital I was then working at to ensure that workers in vital roles had access to fuel so they could continue to perform their duties.
 
 The protesters didn't exactly "wuss" out- they knew what was at stake- the moment their actions caused really serious issues any support they had would evaporate quicker than a puddle of split petrol. At such a point they would have been villified and become public enemy #1.
